snippet: The state’s reliance on the New Mexico clinic is being disparaged by the law’s critics, who say that would be contrary to a recent abortion ruling in Mississippi.
abstract: Proceedings in federal lawsuit challenging Texas' sweeping abortion law have largely centered not on medical or even political issues, but more on mileage and travel distances; state's contention that women in West Texas will not be burdened because they can seek services at clinic across border in New Mexico is being disparaged by law's critics.
lead_paragraph: The state’s reliance on the New Mexico clinic is being disparaged by the law’s critics, who say that would be contrary to a recent abortion ruling in Mississippi.

headline.main: Out-of-State Clinic Is Central in Texas Abortion Law Fight
headline.print_headline: Out-of-State Clinic Is Central in Texas Abortion Law Fight
